alert.note: Alert for Western Highland (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 19 at 1:50AM EST until December 19 at 10:00AM EST by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM EST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations between 4 to 8 inches along and north of Route 250 and 2 to 4 inches south of Route 250. West to northwest wind gusts around 30 to 50 mph are expected as well. * WHERE...Western Highland County. * WHEN...Until 10 AM EST this morning. * IMPACTS...The combination of snow and blowing snow will reduce visibility below one-half mile at times causing near blizzard conditions, especially along and north of Route 250. The hazardous conditions will impact the morning commute today with snow covered and slippery surfaces. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches and a few power outages may result.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. When venturing outside, watch your first few steps taken on steps, sidewalks, and driveways, which could be icy and slippery, increasing your risk of a fall and injury.
